org.fxmisc.livedirs

Class LiveDirs<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fxmisc.livedirs.LiveDirs<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - type of the initiator of I/O actions.

    public class LiveDirs<I>
extends java.lang.Object
    LiveDirs combines a directory watcher, a directory-tree model and a simple I/O facility. The added value of this combination is:
    1. the directory-tree model is updated automatically to reflect the current state of the file-system;
    2. the application can distinguish file-system changes made via the I/O facility from external changes.

    The directory model can be used directly as a model for TreeView.

      • LiveDirs

      • LiveDirs

        public LiveDirs(I externalInitiator,
                java.util.concurrent.Executor clientThreadExecutor)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a LiveDirs instance to be used from a designated thread.
        Parameters:
        externalInitiator - object to represent an initiator of an external file-system change.
        clientThreadExecutor - executor to execute actions on the caller thread. Used to publish updates and errors on the caller thread.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • errors

        public org.reactfx.EventStream<java.lang.Throwable> errors()
        Stream of asynchronously encountered errors.

      • model

        public DirectoryModel<I> model()
        Observable directory model.

      • io

        public InitiatorTrackingIOFacility<I> io()
        Asynchronous I/O facility. All I/O operations performed by this facility are performed on a single thread. It is the same thread that is used to watch the file-system for changes.

      • addTopLevelDirectory

        public void addTopLevelDirectory(java.nio.file.Path dir)
        Adds a directory to watch. The directory will be added to the directory model and watched for changes.

      • refresh

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<java.lang.Void> refresh(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Used to refresh the given subtree of the directory model in case automatic synchronization failed for any reason.

        Guarantees given by WatchService are weak and the behavior may vary on different operating systems. It is possible that the automatic synchronization is not 100% reliable. This method provides a way to request synchronization in case any inconsistencies are observed.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Releases resources used by this LiveDirs instance. In particular, stops the I/O thread (used for I/O operations as well as directory watching).
